1358 “Putin says Russia's new Sarmat nuclear missiles soon ready for deployment,” Reuters, June 21, 2023 [https://www.reu- ters.com/business/aerospace-defense/putin-says-russias-new-sarmat-nuclear-missiles-soon-ready-deployment-2023-06-21/]


1359 Lara Seligman and Lili Bayer, “West eyes Romania as possible F-16 training site for Ukrainian pilots,” Politico, June 21, 2023 [https://www.politico.com/news/2023/06/21/west-eyes-romania-as-possible-f-16-training-site-for-ukrainians-00102916].

Also on June 23, European enlargement commissioner Olivér Várhelyi stated that Ukraine had made good progress on its EU accession journey, but would still need to “deliver” on undertakings before offi- cial accession talks could begin. While Kyiv had made good progress on reforms in judicial governance and media anti-corruption, it now needed to “build a credible track record of prosecutions and convic- tions and to ensure a steady fight against corruption,” he said.1360 In the same vein, Rasmussen stated on June 28 that the EU should not “lower the bar” on membership in terms of corruption and democ- racy, saying to do so would risk “importing instability.” He added that Denmark supported EU member- ship for Ukraine, Moldova, Georgia and the western Balkans, but that “geopolitical circumstances” did not justify skating over governance reforms.1361


Adding to Russian critique of Western arms and ammunition being used to strike Crimea and targets inside Russia, on June 22, the Russia-appointed Kherson governor Vladimir Saldo accused Kyiv of us- ing British-supplied long-range missiles to strike a bridge connecting Kherson province with the Cri- mean peninsula. Ukrainian authorities did not confirm the use of Shadow missiles in the attack on the bridge.1362


At the same time, concerning military developments on the ground, the Ukrainian air force said on June 23 that its air defenses had shot down 13 Russian cruise missiles heading towards a military air- field in the western Khmelnitskyi region.1363


Meanwhile, suggesting intra-elite tensions in Russia were rising, Prigozhin questioned the official justi- fications for invading Ukraine on June 23, criticizing the country’s military top brass for “deceiving” Russian society.1364 One day later, on June 24, Prigozhin attempted an insurrection. The Wagner group took over the city of Rostov, including the headquarters of the southern military district, and started a march on Moscow. In an emergency broadcast, Putin issued a nationwide call for unity in the face of a mutinous strike that he compared to the revolution of 1917. “Any internal mutiny is a deadly threat to

our state, to us as a nation,” he said.1365 The same day, Prigozhin ordered his fighters to withdraw from Rostov and halt their march on Moscow. Under a deal brokered by Lukashenko, Prigozhin agreed to leave Russia in exchange for safe passage to exile in Belarus. On June 26, Putin demanded that Wagner Group forces either join Russia’s conventional military, return to their families, or go to Belarus along- side Prigozhin.1366 Russian authorities closed the mutiny probe into the Wagner Group.1367 On June 27,


1360 “Ukraine war live: Ukraine and Moldova making good progress towards EU membership, European commissioner says,” Guardian, June 22, 2023 [https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2023/jun/22/russia-ukraine-war-live-slow-pace-of-counter- offensive-setting-conditions-for-future-main-effort-usthinktank-says?page].


1361 Ben Hall, “EU should not ‘lower the bar’ to take in Ukraine, says Denmark,” Financial Times, June 29, 2023 [https://www.ft.com/content/3374e390-29ea-4cf0-9a03-c168d1b5614a].


1362 Lorenzo Tondo, “Russia accuses Ukraine of using UK-supplied missiles to strike bridge to Crimea,” Guardian, June 22, 2023 [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/jun/22/russia-accuses-ukraine-uk-missiles-strike-bridge-to-crimea].


1363 AFP News Agency, “#UPDATE Ukraine said on Friday it had downed an entire barrage of 13 cruise missiles,” Twitter @AFP, June 23, 2023 [https://twitter.com/AFP/status/1672170126471462912].


1364 Isabel van Brugen, “Prigozhin Says Putin's Reason for Invading Ukraine Was a Lie,” Newsweek, June 23, 2023 [https://www.newsweek.com/prigozhin-wagner-group-putin-ukraine-war-shoigu-nato-lie-1808700]; Пресс-служба Пригожина “#1829 Публикуем первую часть большого интервью Евгения Пригожина,” Telegram, June 23, 2023 [https://t.me/con- cordgroup_official/1279].


1365 “Ukraine war live: Summary,” Guardian, June 24, 2023 [https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2023/jun/23/russia- ukraine-war-live-russia-investigates-mutiny-as-wagner-chief-says-evil-military-leaders-must-be-stopped].


1366 “National Security Daily: Putin’s message to Wagner,” Politico, June 26, 2023 [https://www.politico.com/newsletters/national- security-daily/2023/06/26/keep-calm-and-tell-ukraine-to-carry-on-00103624].


1367 Andrew Roth, Pjotr Sauer and agencies, “Wagner boss to leave Russia as reports say US spy agencies picked up signs of planned uprising days ago,” Guardian, June 25, 2023 [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/jun/25/wagner-boss-to-leave-

Lukashenko stated that Prigozhin had arrived in Belarus, adding that agreed with his minister of de-

fense that he could use a Wagner unit “as part of the army.”1368 The same day, Putin told members of Russia’s security services that they “in fact stopped a civil war” by acting “clearly and coherently” during Prigozhin’s armed mutiny. “The people and the army were not on the side of the mutineers,” he added.1369


203.

De-escalatory

In reaction to these developments, Western officials worried about the faith of Russia’s nuclear arse- nal. American officials sent diplomatic messages to Russia making clear that they were not involved in the events and considered them an internal Russian matter. They urged Moscow not to use nuclear weapons or escalate. US and European officials agreed behind closed doors that they should remain “silent” and “neutral” about the mutiny. “Any time you have a major country like Russia that has signs of instability, that’s something of concern,” Blinken said on June 25. “When it comes to their nuclear weapons, we have seen no change in their posture, and we have made no change in our own posture. But it’s something, of course, we’re looking at very, very carefully.”1370 On June 26, Biden stated that the US was “not involved” and “had nothing to do with it,” adding that he had agreed with key allies that they “had to make sure” to give Putin “no excuse to blame this on the West and blame this on NATO.”1371 Burns called Naryshkin to assure the Kremlin that Washington had no role in it.1372 How- ever, the same day, Lavrov said Moscow would still look into the potential involvement of Western spies in the rebellion.1373


Reports emerged that, given the instability caused by the insurrection, some Western nations, includ- ing G7 members, had discussed the need for Ukraine not to take advantage of the current situation by, for instance, launching attacks against Russian territory. At the meeting of EU foreign ministers on June 26, some stated that it was not in Europe’s interest to destabilize Russia. These discussions re- vealed a lack of consensus with respect to potential outcomes of the Ukraine crisis – it was not clear who was willing to accept how much instability in Russia and the associated risks for Ukraine to regain

which territories. At the same meeting, Kuleba said now was the time to pump more artillery systems


russia-as-reports-say-us-spy-agencies-picked-up-signs-of-planned-uprising-days-ago]; “Belarus leader says he talked Prigozhin back from brink,” Reuters, June 27, 2023 [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/belarus-leader-says-he-talked-prigozhin- back-brink-2023-06-27/]; Zoya Sheftalovich,“Russia drops charges over Wagner mutiny, reports say,” Politico, June 27, 2023 [https://www.politico.eu/article/russia-drop-charge-wagner-group-mutiny-yevgeny-prigozhin-vladimir-putin/].


1368 “Lukashenko confirms Prigozhin's arrival in Belarus,” BELTA, June 27, 2023 [https://eng.belta.by/presi- dent/view/lukashenko-confirms-prigozhins-arrival-in-belarus-159876-2023/].


1369 Andrew Osborn, “Vladimir Putin thanks Russian army for stopping 'civil war',” Reuters, June 27, 2023 [https://www.reu- ters.com/world/europe/vladimir-putin-thanks-russian-army-stopping-civil-war-2023-06-27/].


1370 Alexander Ward, Lili Bayer, Suzanne Lynch and Cristina Gallardo, “West after Wagner rebellion: Talk softly and help Ukraine carry a bigger stick,” Politico, June 26, 2023 [https://www.politico.eu/article/ukraine-counteroffensive-russia-wagner-rebel- lion/]; Michael R. Gordon and Alan Cullison, “Wagner Mutiny Revives U.S. Fears Over Control of Russia’s Nuclear Weapons,” Wallstreet Journal, June 25, 2023 [https://www.wsj.com/articles/wagner-mutiny-revives-u-s-fears-over-control-of-russias-nu- clear-weapons-29319369].


1371 Jeff Mason, Steve Holland and Simon Lewis, “Biden: US, allies not involved in uprising against Putin,” Reuters, June 26, 2023 [https://www.reuters.com/world/biden-us-allies-not-involved-uprising-against-putin-2023-06-26/].


1372 Julian E. Barnes, “The director of the C.I.A. called the Kremlin to make clear the U.S. had no tie to Wagner’s rebellion,” New York Times, June 30, 2023 [https://www.nytimes.com/2023/06/30/world/europe/cia-william-burns-russia-wagner-rebel- lion.html?searchResultPosition=1].


1373 “Russia checking if Western agencies were involved in mutiny: foreign minister,” Reuters, June 26, 2023 [https://www.reu- ters.com/world/europe/russia-checking-if-western-agencies-were-involved-mutiny-foreign-minister-2023-06-26/].

and missiles into Kyiv’s arsenal, place more sanctions on Russia, and speed up the training of Ukrainian pilots on advanced fighter jets.1374


Some western heads of state and government, as well as defense and foreign ministers still further com- mented on the mutiny. Macron stated on June 25 that the revolt lead by Wagner against the country’s leadership would show the “divisions” that existed “within the Russian camp, and the fragility of both its military and its auxiliary forces.”1375 The same day, Nauseda cautioned that NATO would need to strengthen its eastern flank if Belarus became the new host of Wagner. 1376 Reznikov stated he had had a phone call with Austin and both had agreed that the Russian authorities were weak and that with- drawing Russian troops from Ukraine was “the best choice for the Kremlin” as “Russia would be better served to address its own issues.”1377 On June 26, Borrell said that Russia had thus far posed a threat because it had been strong and had had force, while now it was also “becoming a risk because it may

have entered an era of political instability and internal fragility.”1378 Kirby stated the same day that the US government was “not taking sides in this internal matter,” 1379 while Cleverly said that Prigozhin’s rebellion was “an unprecedented challenge to president Putin’s authority” and that “cracks” were emerging “in Russian support for the war.”1380 On June 27, Duda stated that the relocation Wagner to Belarus were “all very negative signals for us which we want to raise strongly with our allies.”1381 At a meeting of NATO allies on June 28, Duda reiterated that the Wagner group’s presence in Belarus could “be a potential danger” for his country and for Lithuania, which share borders with Belarus.1382


204.

De-escalatory

Meanwhile, on June 25, Lavrov, referring to Biden’s statement that the threat of Russia using tactical nuclear weapons was “real,” commented that he would not attach too much importance “to verbal es- capades that have no foundation.”1383


1374 Henry Foy, Sam Fleming, and Felicia Schwartz “West explores nuclear risks from unstable Putin regime,” Financial Times, June 26, 2023 [https://www.ft.com/content/35b0291b-5d02-4869-851b-a1de4080c5f6].


1375 Aurélien Viers, Florent Provansal and François Tonneau, “Macron : ‘La rébellion de Wagner montre les divisions au sein du camp russe’,” Provence, June 25, 2023 [https://www.laprovence.com/article/politique/9427644555835815/info-la-provence- macron-la-rebellion-de-wagner-montre-les-divisions-au-sein-du-camp-russe].


1376 “Vilnius Urges Beefed-Up NATO If Prigozhin In Belarus,” Radio Free Europe, June 25, 2023 [https://www.rferl.org/a/vilnius- urges-beefed-up-nato-if-prigozhin-in-belarus/32475182.html].


1377 Oleksii Reznikov, “Had a phone conversation with my friend and colleague @SecDef Lloyd Austin III,” Twitter @oleksiireznikov, June 25, 2023 [https://twitter.com/oleksiireznikov/status/1673024465410588673].


1378 “Foreign Affairs Council: Press remarks by High Representative Josep Borrell at the press conference,” European External Ac- tion Service, June 26, 2023 [https://www.eeas.europa.eu/eeas/foreign-affairs-council-press-remarks-high-representative-josep- borrell-press-conference-1_en].


1379 Jeff Mason, Steve Holland and Simon Lewis, “Biden: US, allies not involved in uprising against Putin,” Reuters, June 26, 2023 [https://www.reuters.com/world/biden-us-allies-not-involved-uprising-against-putin-2023-06-26/].


1380 “UK's Cleverly: Prigozhin's rebellion is an unprecedented challenge to Russia's Putin,” Reuters, June 26, 2023 [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/uks-cleverly-prigozhins-rebellion-is-an-unprecedented-challenge-russias-putin-2023- 06-26/].


1381 “Ukraine war live: Closing summary,” Guardian, June 27, 2023 [https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2023/jun/27/rus- sia-ukraine-war-live-putin-confirms-russian-pilots-killed-during-wagner-mutiny-zelenskiy-visits-front].


1382 Cora Engelbrecht and Steven Erlanger, “NATO Stresses Risk of Wagner Group’s Potential Relocation to Belarus,” New York Times, June 28, 2023 [https://www.nytimes.com/2023/06/28/world/europe/wagner-belarus-nato-estonia-poland.html].


1383 “Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov's answers to questions from Moscow. Kremlin. Putin programme, June 25, 2023,” Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation, June 25, 2023 [https://mid.ru/en/foreign_policy/news/1892818/].

In other news, acting Danish defense minister Troels Lund Poulsen on June 26 announced the start of training for Ukrainian pilots on F-16 jets. He added that Denmark would also consider whether it “should make a concrete donation to Ukraine of the Danish F-16 fighters, and how many there should be.”1384


Also on June 26, Bulgaria’s Economy Minister Bogdan Bogdanov suggested Russia may have been re- sponsible for an explosion in the early hours of June 25 at an arms factory in the town of Karnobat in eastern Bulgaria.1385


Concerning further military support for Ukraine, on June 27, the Pentagon announced that the United States would provide Kyiv with a new military package worth up to $500m, including ground vehicles like Bradley fighting vehicles and Stryker armored personnel carriers, and munitions for high mobility artillery rocket systems.1386 On June 28, Nauséda confirmed that his country was to supply Ukraine with two Namsam launchers.1387 The same day, Pistorius stated that Germany “should supply more arms deliveries” abroad, and had to “change the corresponding restrictions,” adding that establishing lasting weapons supplies to Ukraine was “crucial.”1388 The same June 28, Blinken stated that NATO al- lies would unveil “a very robust package for Ukraine, political and practical” during the Vilnius sum- mit.1389


At the same time, the Russian government appeared to take retribution steps against Wagner support- ers. Russian army general Sergei Surovikin was detained as part of a crack-down, apparently accused that he had known about Prigozhin’s plans, media reported on June 29.1390 In Washington, the Biden Administration was “considering” sending Army Tactical Missile Systems to Ukraine, journalists noted on the same day. The White House, long reluctant on this question, seemed to have softened its position, US and European officials told journalists.1391


Also on June 29, Ukraine conducted nuclear disaster response drills in the vicinity of the Russian-occu- pied powerplant at Zaporizhzhia, claiming that Russia was potentially planning to destroy the power- plant. In New York, Nebenzia wrote to Guterres to say that Russia had “no intention” to “blow up” the


1384 “Denmark to start the training of Ukrainian pilots on F-16s,” AP, June 26, 2023 [https://apnews.com/article/denmark- ukraine-f16-training-f35-2affe4143ce2debeef486285ac1f8904].


1385 Nicolas Camut, “Bulgaria’s economy minister hints Russians attacked ammo factory,” Politico, June 26, 2023 [https://www.po- litico.eu/article/bulgaria-economy-minister-bogdan-bogdanov-nikolay-denkov-hints-at-russian-attack-on-ammunition-factory/].


1386 Joseph Clark, “Pentagon Announces $500M in Security Assistance for Ukraine,” US Department of Defense, June 27, 2023 [https://www.defense.gov/News/News-Stories/Article/Article/3441398/pentagon-announces-500m-in-security-assistance-for- ukraine/].


1387 Andrius Sytas, “Lithuania buys NASAMS air defence for Ukraine,” Reuters, June 28, 2023 [https://www.reuters.com/world/eu- rope/lithuania-buys-nasams-air-defence-ukraine-2023-06-28/].


1388 Erika Solomon, “German Defense Minister Vows Stronger Geopolitical Role Ahead of U.S. Visit,” New York Times, June 28, 2023 [https://www.nytimes.com/2023/06/28/world/europe/german-defense-minister-pistorius-stronger-geopolitical-role.html].


1389 Council on Foreign Relations, “A Conversation with Secretary of State Antony Blinken,” Youtube, June 28, 2023 [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OuaF_Gw5l5w].


1390 Max Seddon, Henry Foy and Polina Ivanova “Russia detains ‘General Armageddon’ in crackdown on pro-Wagner elites,” Finan- cial Times, June 29, 2023 [https://www.ft.com/content/e937199c-a5c1-45d9-85bc-85cf75a3528d].


1391 Vivian Salama, “U.S. Considers ATACMS Long-Range Missiles to Bolster Ukraine’s Fight,” Wallstreet Journal, June 29, 2023 [https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-close-to-approving-long-range-atacms-missiles-to-bolster-ukraines-fight-cc4e389c].

facility.1392 However, Ukraine’s military intelligence claimed on June 29 that Russia was gradually re- ducing the number of personnel at Zaporizhzhia, and among the first to leave were employees of Rosatom.1393


In Brussels, on the same June 29, after EU leaders concluded to “stand ready” to help Ukraine defend itself in the long term, Borrell noted that military support for Ukraine had to be “for the long haul,” as Ukraine needed EU “commitment to continue ensuring their security during the war and after the war.”1394 However, Hungarian prime minister Viktor Orbán said on June 30 that he rejected the EU plans to grant more money to Ukraine.1395


Also on June 29, US ambassador to NATO Julianne Smith said that most officials were confident the Al- liance could agree at Vilnius on something “above and beyond restating Bucharest.” Allowing Ukraine to skip a MAP was “one option” that they were “looking at.”1396


Ukraine’s counteroffensive received the spotlight on the last day of June. In Kyiv, Valery Zaluzhny, the commander of Ukraine’s armed forces, said to reporters that “without being fully supplied, these plans” of the counteroffensive were “not feasible at all,” adding that they were still “being carried out” and, hence, the advance was slow. He complained about the lack of fighter jets, saying that Russia was tech- nologically more advanced. When asked whether he feared a Russia nuclear escalation or an explosion at Zaporizhzhia, he said: “It doesn’t stop me at all. We are doing our job. All these signals come from out- side for some reason: ‘Be afraid of a nuclear strike.’ Well, should we give up?” 1397 In Washington, Milley told journalists that the counteroffensive was “advancing steadily,” but it was going to be “very difficult,” “very bloody,” and “very long.”1398


1392 Serhiy Chaliy, “Ukraine conducts disaster response drills near Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant,” Reuters, June 29, 2023 [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukraine-conducts-disaster-response-drills-near-zaporizhzhia-nuclear-plant-2023-06- 29/].


1393 “Russia reducing personnel at Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant - Ukrainian intelligence,” Reuters, June 30, 2023 [https://www.swissinfo.ch/eng/russia-reducing-personnel-at-zaporizhzhia-nuclear-plant---ukrainian-intelligence/48631148].


1394 Andrew Gray and Julia Payne, “EU leaders back security commitments for Ukraine,” Reuters, June 30, 2023 [https://www.reu- ters.com/world/europe/eu-leaders-debate-russia-mutiny-pledge-support-ukraine-2023-06-29/].


1395 “Hungary opposes EU plan to grant more money to Ukraine, Orban says,” Reuters, June 30, 2023 [https://www.reu- ters.com/world/europe/hungary-opposes-eu-plan-grant-more-money-ukraine-pm-orban-2023-06-30/].


1396 “NATO to 'stand behind' Ukraine at summit; Stoltenberg mandate extended,” AFP, June 29, 2023 [https://www.space- war.com/reports/NATO_to_show_it_stands_behind_Ukraine_at_summit_US_999.html].


1397 Isabelle Khurshudyan, “Ukraine’s top general, Valery Zaluzhny, wants shells, planes and patience,” Washington Post, June 30, 2023 [https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2023/06/30/valery-zaluzhny-ukraine-general-interview/].


1398 Olena Harmash, “Ukraine, US agree: counteroffensive creeps ahead, measured in blood,” Reuters, June 30, 2023 [https://www.reuters.com/article/ukraine-crisis-counteroffensive-idCAKBN2YG1TU].

Dr Liviu Horovitz is a Re- search Associate in the Inter- national Security Division.


Martha Stolze is a Research Assistant in the International Security Division.


Anna Clara Arndt was a co- author on the previous three iterations of this working pa- per until January 2023. Since then, she has not been in- volved in the project.
